description.narrative: The project will work with two groups of adolescent girls age 10-19 totaling 40,000 girls: (1) Girls who have dropped out of early primary grades without attaining sufficient numeracy and literacy skills, most of whom are involved in paid or unpaid domestic work. Older girls are likely to be already married. (2) Girls who have never enrolled in school, extremely vulnerable to early marriage or already adolescent wives and mothers. Most are involved in casual work and have limited time and interest to pursue regular education options. , the project will work with the government, communities and education providers to offer three tailored pathways for girls to access quality education over a period of 4 years: - An 11-month alternative basic education (ABE) course will enable young adolescents (girls and boys) who dropped out or have never been to school to reach a Grade 4 level, become fluent readers and fully numerate, and acquire basic life skills (financial literacy, leadership skills, communication and negotiation).

mailing-address.narrative: P.O.BOX 2039 - 00202, KNH Post Office, Nairobi, Kenya
